intro: Tournefortiopsis discolor, commonly known as the pale-flowered tournefortiopsis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with a distinctive pale disc floret in the center. Tournefortiopsis discolor is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often flowering after rainfall.
